channel.title: Do clients hate
channel.description:
Every time I use a 377 client it says error connecting to server to anything...
Also when using any client also...any idea..

item.title: Do clients hate
item.dc:creator: @Stilles Stilles
item.description:
@Stilles wrote:

Ah, ok i get you. One sec. Ill tell you how to change it. Its somewhat time consuming but it works :D[br][size=1]Posted on: June 12, 2007, 04:45:18 PM[/size][hr]Go into your client folder and open up client.java (its near the bottom)

Search For public static void setserver(String ip, String frameids, String packets)

Under that you should see something of this sortserver = "127.0.0.1"; //showframeids = Integer.parseInt(frameids.substring(1)); //showpackets = Integer.parseInt(packets.substring(1));

Change the 127.0.0.1 to whatever ip you wish to connect to (it probably doesnt say 127.0.0.1, it most likely says the ip of the client’s server)

Also you need to change a few more things.

public final void method64(int i) { server = "127.0.0.1";

aString1173 = ""; aString1174 = ""; server = "127.0.0.1";

Change all the 127.0.0.1 to the server you want to connect to like i said.

Save, compile, run.

Also, i think if you need to change the port look for aClass24_1168 = new Class24(this, -978, method19(43594 + anInt958));

Change 43594 to the server’s port.

Read full topic

item.title: Do clients hate
item.dc:creator: @Legend1 -Legend-
item.description:
@Legend1 wrote:

Stilles:

Use the moparscape 3.2 client, it has the port function.

I need a 377 client for this server…I can’t play any other server but localhost/127.0.0.1

@Stilles wrote:

Do you have the right port? Most clients are fixed so that they will only connect to the server they were made for.
